jobs.title: Health Economist
jobs.description:
Mendelian.co is a digital health company based in London building technologies to accelerate the diagnosis of patients with rare and hard to diagnose diseases. Our team of clinicians, data scientists and software engineers are tackling the most complicated diagnoses on a national and global scale. Rare diseases (all 7,000 known types combined) affect over 350m people and take on average 7 years to diagnose in clinics.

Mendelian software is used by the NHS and thousands of doctors from 140 countries and has attracted acclaim from top researchers and clinical doctors in the field.
üëã Who we are  üëã
Mendelian is a round table of physicians and data scientists. We hold weekly sprints to prioritise work at a company level. We cook for each other on Thursdays. Technical staff meet practising doctors and medical staff get down and dirty with the code. We go on annual retreats and are flexible around working hours.

We make working in health feel modern.
üöÄMission üöÄ 
Our mission is to help doctors diagnose rare disease patients faster.
Faster diagnosis is key to the future of the NHS and healthcare abroad, from improving the lives of chronically sick people to reducing inefficiencies in overburdened hospitals. We are deploying early detection systems for rare diseases, some of the most difficult and protracted diagnoses for doctors to make.

We believe that delayed diagnosis is an information challenge and that technological innovation is central to achieving our mission. Founded by engineers and doctors, we've held our technology and clinical mind  to high standards from the beginning.

If you want to learn more about our mission, and about how rare diseases aren't that rare at all, then check out our publication Why we do what we do.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Team  üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶
We are a small team of clinicians, data scientists and software engineers based in Shoreditch. We work flexible hours, boast membership to a great co-working space, and, on Thursdays, take turns making a surprisingly high quality lunch. Do you have any culinary delights you want to share?
üéØRole üéØ
We've successfully deployed our solution into clinics, scanning and reviewing hundreds of thousands of electronic medical records for symptoms of rare disease. Over the next year we need to scale up our systems and processes in order to process millions more. 

We're hiring a Health Economist as a key role in the Company to help us measure the impact we‚Äôre having on the healthcare systems more quantitatively. As part of our team, the candidate should be willing to take ownership of the leading-edge research to evaluate the clinical, humanistic and economic value of Mendelian.

üí™Responsibilities üí™
You will be responsible for leading projects and communicating methods and outcomes to the team and stakeholders. 
You will work on innovative approaches to use health economics in rare diseases.
You will conduct searches in electronic databases, such as PubMed, and knowledge of the systematic review process.
You will build health economics models, including cost-effectiveness, cost-of-illness, and budget impact analysis.
You will produce consistently high quality work within tight deadlines.
You will collaborate with the clinical team.
You will write and present posters at conferences. 

üü¢ Requirements üü¢
Masters Degree in Health Economics, Health Policy, Public Health or relevant disciplines.
Health economic experience in either in-house, research, consulting, Pharma or HTA bodies is desirable..
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills to explain complex concepts to an audience of non-health economists..
Experience with Microsoft Office suite of programmes (Excel mostly).
Initiative and problem-solving ability, eager to break new ground and create opportunities for others.
Great baking skills is a plus :) 
‚≠ê Important info  ‚≠ê
Location: London (Remote during Covid19)
Job type: Full-time
Salary: ¬£30k ‚Äì ¬£40k
Meaningful equity package
Visa sponsorship: not available.
We do not work with recruiters. 

To apply, please send your LinkedIn profile or your CV with a note to contact@mendelian.co

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Do something that matters
jobs.description:
**Mission**
Our mission is to help doctors diagnose rare disease patients faster.

Faster diagnosis is key to the future of the NHS and healthcare abroad, from improving the lives of chronically sick people to reducing inefficiencies in overburdened hospitals. We are deploying early detection systems for rare diseases, some of the most difficult and protracted diagnoses for doctors to make.

We believe that delayed diagnosis is an information challenge and that technological innovation is central to achieving our mission. Founded by computer scientists, we've held our technology to high standards from the beginning.

If you want to learn more about our mission, and about how rare diseases aren't that rare at all, then check out our publication [Why we do what we do](https://www.mendelian.co/blog/why-we-do-what-we-do).

**Team**
We are a small team of clinicians, health economists, data scientists and software engineers based in Shoreditch. We work flexible hours, boast membership to a great co-working space, and, on Thursdays, take turns making a surprisingly high quality lunch. Do you have any culinary delights you want to share?

**Role**
We've successfully deployed our solution into clinics, scanning and reviewing hundreds of thousands of electronic medical records for symptoms of rare disease. Over the next year we need to scale up our systems and processes in order to process millions more. We're hiring another software engineer as we need more skilled hands and expertise in order to achieve this goal.

Responsibilities:
* Building AI assisted clinical tools for our in-house clinical team.
* Creating data pipelines to add new data sources.
* Integrating with third-party health care systems.
* Empowering our data scientists and health economists with knowledge, data and tooling.
* Encouraging good software development processes and practices.

Current Stack:
* APIs and data pipelines written in Python.
* Web apps written in JavaScript and React.
* Data stored in PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch and high performance networked file systems.
* Systems developed, tested and deployed with Docker and Jenkins.
* Cloud infrastructure hosted on AWS, provisioned with Terraform, monitored with ELK and administered with Samba.

Come help us turn software into diagnoses for the 1 in 17 people that suffer from a rare disease.

**Requirements**
* Great practical knowledge of software engineering.
* Fluency in Python and JavaScript.
* Familiarity with the rest of our stack.
* Experience fully owning a project, from gathering requirements through to deployment.
* You must be willing to live or relocate to London and have the right to work in the UK. Unfortunately, we won't be sponsoring VISA for the candidate.
